On Sun, 07 Nov 2004 21:09:56 +0000, Colin Green <cgreen@...> wrote:
> A couple of ideas therefore emerge:
> 
> 1) Prevent unfortunate discarding of good genomes by keeping a library
> of previous champions seperate from the main population. 

Yes...a "Hall of Fame".  I've seen this implemented in a few
GAs...it's not a bad idea in general, I think.

> 2) Some kind of hybrid evaluation scheme might be useful. e.g. Consider
> the following eval scheme:
> 
>  - Use random tests as normal.
>  - If a genome is encountered that scores 100% then test it against a
> more exhaustive test set (or just a lot more random tests).
>  - Note any tests that fail - hopefully there won't be too many - these
> are now 'special' test cases..
>  - Subsequent evaluations can now use random tests *and* the set of
> previously failed tests.

Yes, that sounds like a good plan, to flag the outliers and keep them
in a special test set.

Thanks for the feedback.

Derek
